thread.title: Cardinals fall again with second straight defeat

author: Danny Shapiro
title: Cardinals fall again with second straight defeat

Photo taken Saturday, October 24, 2015 Kim Brent/The ... more Image 28 of 28 Cardinals fall again with second straight defeat 1 / 28 Back to Gallery 
Lamar couldn't keep up with Central Arkansas despite another stellar performance from junior running back Kade Harrington as the Cardinals fell 35-17 to Central Arkansas Saturday at Provost Umphrey Stadium . 
Harrington ran for 243 yards and two touchdowns but the Cardinals (3-4, 2-3 Southland) couldn't keep pace with the Bears (4-3, 4-1), who won for the fourth time in their past five games. 
Central Arkansas senior running back Blake Veasley ran for 292 yards and four touchdowns on a school-record 49 carries as the Bears built a 21-3 halftime lead. 
Veasley's 56-yard touchdown run on the Bears' first possession of the second half pushed the score to 28-3 but Harrington kept the Cardinals close. 
Harrington scored from touchdown runs of 65 and 50 yards in the third quarter to narrow the lead to 28-17 but the Cardinals' comeback stalled there. 
Veasley added his fourth touchdown of the night, a 19-yard run, with 12:38 remaining after a Joe Minden interception to finish the scoring and bury the Cardinals. 
It was another rough night for Minden, Lamar's senior quarterback, who finished 14 of 27 for 143 yards and five interceptions. 
With the loss, the Cardinals lost back-to-back games for the first time since Oct. 2013. 
The Cardinals return to action next Saturday at 2 p.m. on the road against Houston Baptist. 
DShapiro@BeaumontEnterprise.comTwitter.com/DannyShapiro13
